intro: Withania echinata, commonly known as the horned devil or Indian winter cherry, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of India and Pakistan. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its branched stems, small greenish-white flowers, and distinctive yellow-orange berries that contain toxic seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert environments. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for agricultural purposes.
